body.p: Alarms for all devices in the Color Monitor’s device chain (the PDU internal network) are reflected to the Monitor and displayed on the Alarm screen. The number of active alarms and warnings is shown in every screen header of the WaveStar Color Monitor. When there are no active alarms, a green check mark is displayed in the header. WaveStar Monitoring: Alarm and Warning Status Icons

To display alarms, touch the ALARM Button. Active alarms are listed in chronological sequence with the device name and alarm or warning. Alarms and warnings remain on the screen as long as they are active.

fig.title: WaveStar Monitoring: ALARM Screen with an Alarm List

body.p: Each PDU device (PDU-Contractor Board or BCMS subfeed group) has its own Modbus points list. A customer BIM or DCIM system or other Modbus master can read alarms from these points lists. There is also an SNMP MIB covering all possible device types.
Alarm tables by device type (such as monitor, PDU, subfeeds) are given in the Color Monitor manual. See WaveStar Color Monitor, Setup and Operation P-164001109.

In addition, the Color Monitor has a dry contact (NO) connection on the backpanel that signals a summary alarm whenever any alarm is present in the Monitor’s device chain. (See connector location in )
